ArgNum

The argument class used for any numeric data.

Passes

A number value, defaulting to 0.

Variables
ArgNum Variables

All these variables are optional, with sensible defaults. See Arg.Arg Variables above for an important note.

_Min

A number or nil specifying the minimum value for the argument.

_Max

A number or nil specifying the maximum value for the argument.

_Round

A number or nil specifying the digit to round to, as passed to UtilX.Round.

_Hint

A string (usually a word or two) used in help output to give users a general idea of what the argument is for.

Functions
UsageShort
UsageShort: (
str = "" using nil
) =>

See Arg.UsageShort.

UsageLong
UsageLong: (
str = "" using nil
) =>

See Arg.UsageLong.

IsValid
IsValid: (
obj using nil
) =>

See Arg.IsValid. For ArgNum, "valid" is anything that passes tonumber().

Parse
Parse: (
obj using nil
) =>

See Arg.Parse.

Returns
1

A boolean. True if the argument was parsed, false otherwise.

2

The parsed and rounded number or a translated string explaining why it couldn't be parsed.

IsPermissible
IsPermissible: (
num using nil
) =>

See Arg.IsPermissible. For ArgNum, checks the bounds of the number.

Parameters
num

A number or nil.

Serialize
Serialize: (
using nil
) =>

See Arg.Serialize.

Returns

A string in the format "min_num:max_num".

Deserialize
@Deserialize: (
str using nil
) ->

See Arg.Deserialize.
